content.webTitle: Stanley Gibbons expands in collectibles haven

fields.headline: Stanley Gibbons expands in collectibles haven
fields.bodyText: Philately specialist Stanley Gibbons yesterday said it may have to recruit more experts to cash in on the spiralling demand for stamps as an investment. Jersey-based Stanley Gibbons, founded in 1856, said pre-tax profits rose 42% to £1.7m after the values of 100 of the world's most frequently traded stamps rose 10% over the past year. Annual sales broke through the £10m barrier after the group exploited investors' desire to seek havens for their savings outside the stock market. In 1998, the largest known block of Penny Black stamps, postmarked May 6 1840, pictured above, fetched £220,000 when auctioned by Stanley Gibbons in London. The firm also says it has joined with a "global bank" to create a fund for investors in the stamp market.
